availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James William Lindsey Sr. (Marshall County clergyman)

body.p: Residence: Briansburg, Marshall County, Kentucky. An elder and clergyman of the Church of Christ. Born in Yadkinville, Yadkin County, North Carolina. Married Tabitha Carver in Barren County, Kentucky in 1821. Moved from Carroll County, Tennessee to Marshall County, Kentucky, c1829, where he spent the rest of his life. Preached at Green Plain, Blood River, etc.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Briensburg post office, p. 108.

Find A Grave, Entry for Elder James William Lindsey (1804-1891), Find A Grave Memorial # 31227860, Old Union Cemetery, Briensburg, Marshall County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=lindsey&GSfn=james&GSby=1804&GSbyrel=in&GSdyrel=in&GSob=n&GRid=31227860&df=all& (accessed 9 Jul 2017).
